item.title: Learning Jekyll and Getting Started with Github Pages
item.author: shadowimmage@gmail.com (Chase Sawyer)
item.description: First Post! Learning how to set up Jekyll on GitHub Pages is actually a little harder than I was expecting from the outset. Mostly because most of the things that you need to set up Jekyll for local development, and a lot of the things that come prepackaged with it aren’t actually necessary for running it on GitHub Pages. Here is the Gemfile content for this page when I first started and got things working:
